76  /**
77   * This class manages the procedure of taking and restoring snapshots. There is only one
78   * SnapshotManager for the master.
79   * <p>
80   * The class provides methods for monitoring in-progress snapshot actions.
81   * <p>
82   * Note: Currently there can only be one snapshot being taken at a time over the cluster. This is a
83   * simplification in the current implementation.
84   */
85  @InterfaceAudience.Private
86  @InterfaceStability.Unstable
87  public class SnapshotManager implements Stoppable {
88    private static final Log LOG = LogFactory.getLog(SnapshotManager.class);
89  
90    /** By default, check to see if the snapshot is complete every WAKE MILLIS (ms) */
91    private static final int SNAPSHOT_WAKE_MILLIS_DEFAULT = 500;
92  
93    /**
94     * Wait time before removing a finished sentinel from the in-progress map
95     *
96     * NOTE: This is used as a safety auto cleanup.
97     * The snapshot and restore handlers map entries are removed when a user asks if a snapshot or
98     * restore is completed. This operation is part of the HBaseAdmin snapshot/restore API flow.
99     * In case something fails on the client side and the snapshot/restore state is not reclaimed
100    * after a default timeout, the entry is removed from the in-progress map.
101    * At this point, if the user asks for the snapshot/restore status, the result will be
102    * snapshot done if exists or failed if it doesn't exists.
103    */
104   private static final int SNAPSHOT_SENTINELS_CLEANUP_TIMEOUT = 60 * 1000;
105 
106   /** Enable or disable snapshot support */
107   public static final String HBASE_SNAPSHOT_ENABLED = "hbase.snapshot.enabled";
108 
109   /**
110    * Conf key for # of ms elapsed between checks for snapshot errors while waiting for
111    * completion.
112    */
113   private static final String SNAPSHOT_WAKE_MILLIS_KEY = "hbase.snapshot.master.wakeMillis";
114 
115   /** By default, check to see if the snapshot is complete (ms) */
116   private static final int SNAPSHOT_TIMEOUT_MILLIS_DEFAULT = 60000;
117 
118   /**
119    * Conf key for # of ms elapsed before injecting a snapshot timeout error when waiting for
120    * completion.
121    */
122   private static final String SNAPSHOT_TIMEOUT_MILLIS_KEY = "hbase.snapshot.master.timeoutMillis";
123 
124   /** Name of the operation to use in the controller */
125   public static final String ONLINE_SNAPSHOT_CONTROLLER_DESCRIPTION = "online-snapshot";
126 
127   /** Conf key for # of threads used by the SnapshotManager thread pool */
128   private static final String SNAPSHOT_POOL_THREADS_KEY = "hbase.snapshot.master.threads";
129 
130   /** number of current operations running on the master */
131   private static final int SNAPSHOT_POOL_THREADS_DEFAULT = 1;

133   private boolean stopped;
134   private final MasterServices master;  // Needed by TableEventHandlers
135   private final MasterMetrics metricsMaster;
136   private final ProcedureCoordinator coordinator;

138   // Is snapshot feature enabled?
139   private boolean isSnapshotSupported = false;
140 
141   // Snapshot handlers map, with table name as key.
142   // The map is always accessed and modified under the object lock using synchronized.
143   // snapshotTable() will insert an Handler in the table.
144   // isSnapshotDone() will remove the handler requested if the operation is finished.
145   private Map<String, SnapshotSentinel> snapshotHandlers = new HashMap<String, SnapshotSentinel>();
146 
147   // Restore Sentinels map, with table name as key.
148   // The map is always accessed and modified under the object lock using synchronized.
149   // restoreSnapshot()/cloneSnapshot() will insert an Handler in the table.
150   // isRestoreDone() will remove the handler requested if the operation is finished.
151   private Map<String, SnapshotSentinel> restoreHandlers = new HashMap<String, SnapshotSentinel>();
152 
153   private final Path rootDir;
154   private final ExecutorService executorService;

156   /**
157    * Construct a snapshot manager.
158    * @param master
159    */
160   public SnapshotManager(final MasterServices master, final MasterMetrics metricsMaster)
161       throws KeeperException, IOException, UnsupportedOperationException {
162     this.master = master;
163     this.metricsMaster = metricsMaster;
164 
165     checkSnapshotSupport(master.getConfiguration(), master.getMasterFileSystem());
166 
167     // get the configuration for the coordinator
168     Configuration conf = master.getConfiguration();
169     long wakeFrequency = conf.getInt(SNAPSHOT_WAKE_MILLIS_KEY, SNAPSHOT_WAKE_MILLIS_DEFAULT);
170     long timeoutMillis = conf.getLong(SNAPSHOT_TIMEOUT_MILLIS_KEY, SNAPSHOT_TIMEOUT_MILLIS_DEFAULT);
171     int opThreads = conf.getInt(SNAPSHOT_POOL_THREADS_KEY, SNAPSHOT_POOL_THREADS_DEFAULT);
172 
173     // setup the default procedure coordinator
174     String name = master.getServerName().toString();
175     ThreadPoolExecutor tpool = ProcedureCoordinator.defaultPool(name, opThreads);
176     ProcedureCoordinatorRpcs comms = new ZKProcedureCoordinatorRpcs(
177         master.getZooKeeper(), SnapshotManager.ONLINE_SNAPSHOT_CONTROLLER_DESCRIPTION, name);
178 
179     this.coordinator = new ProcedureCoordinator(comms, tpool, timeoutMillis, wakeFrequency);
180     this.rootDir = master.getMasterFileSystem().getRootDir();
181     this.executorService = master.getExecutorService();
182     resetTempDir();
183   }
184 
185   /**
186    * Fully specify all necessary components of a snapshot manager. Exposed for testing.
187    * @param master services for the master where the manager is running
188    * @param coordinator procedure coordinator instance.  exposed for testing.
189    * @param pool HBase ExecutorServcie instance, exposed for testing.
190    */
191   public SnapshotManager(final MasterServices master, final MasterMetrics metricsMaster,
192       ProcedureCoordinator coordinator, ExecutorService pool)
193       throws IOException, UnsupportedOperationException {
194     this.master = master;
195     this.metricsMaster = metricsMaster;
196 
197     checkSnapshotSupport(master.getConfiguration(), master.getMasterFileSystem());
198 
199     this.coordinator = coordinator;
200     this.rootDir = master.getMasterFileSystem().getRootDir();
201     this.executorService = pool;
202     resetTempDir();
203   }

205   /**
206    * Gets the list of all completed snapshots.
207    * @return list of SnapshotDescriptions
208    * @throws IOException File system exception
209    */
210   public List<SnapshotDescription> getCompletedSnapshots() throws IOException {
211     return getCompletedSnapshots(SnapshotDescriptionUtils.getSnapshotsDir(rootDir));
212   }
213 
214   /**
215    * Gets the list of all completed snapshots.
216    * @param snapshotDir snapshot directory
217    * @return list of SnapshotDescriptions
218    * @throws IOException File system exception
219    */
220   private List<SnapshotDescription> getCompletedSnapshots(Path snapshotDir) throws IOException {
221     List<SnapshotDescription> snapshotDescs = new ArrayList<SnapshotDescription>();
222     // first create the snapshot root path and check to see if it exists
223     FileSystem fs = master.getMasterFileSystem().getFileSystem();
224     if (snapshotDir == null) snapshotDir = SnapshotDescriptionUtils.getSnapshotsDir(rootDir);
225 
226     // if there are no snapshots, return an empty list
227     if (!fs.exists(snapshotDir)) {
228       return snapshotDescs;
229     }
230 
231     // ignore all the snapshots in progress
232     FileStatus[] snapshots = fs.listStatus(snapshotDir,
233       new SnapshotDescriptionUtils.CompletedSnaphotDirectoriesFilter(fs));
234     // loop through all the completed snapshots
235     for (FileStatus snapshot : snapshots) {
236       Path info = new Path(snapshot.getPath(), SnapshotDescriptionUtils.SNAPSHOTINFO_FILE);
237       // if the snapshot is bad
238       if (!fs.exists(info)) {
239         LOG.error("Snapshot information for " + snapshot.getPath() + " doesn't exist");
240         continue;
241       }
242       FSDataInputStream in = null;
243       try {
244         in = fs.open(info);
245         SnapshotDescription desc = SnapshotDescription.parseFrom(in);
246         snapshotDescs.add(desc);
247       } catch (IOException e) {
248         LOG.warn("Found a corrupted snapshot " + snapshot.getPath(), e);
249       } finally {
250         if (in != null) {
251           in.close();
252         }
253       }
254     }
255     return snapshotDescs;
256   }
257 
258   /**
259    * Cleans up any snapshots in the snapshot/.tmp directory that were left from failed
260    * snapshot attempts.
261    *
262    * @throws IOException if we can't reach the filesystem
263    */
264   void resetTempDir() throws IOException {
265     // cleanup any existing snapshots.
266     Path tmpdir = SnapshotDescriptionUtils.getWorkingSnapshotDir(rootDir);
267     if (!master.getMasterFileSystem().getFileSystem().delete(tmpdir, true)) {
268       LOG.warn("Couldn't delete working snapshot directory: " + tmpdir);
269     }
270   }
271 
272   /**
273    * Delete the specified snapshot
274    * @param snapshot
275    * @throws SnapshotDoesNotExistException If the specified snapshot does not exist.
276    * @throws IOException For filesystem IOExceptions
277    */
278   public void deleteSnapshot(SnapshotDescription snapshot) throws SnapshotDoesNotExistException, IOException {
279 
280     // call coproc pre hook
281     MasterCoprocessorHost cpHost = master.getCoprocessorHost();
282     if (cpHost != null) {
283       cpHost.preDeleteSnapshot(snapshot);
284     }
285 
286     // check to see if it is completed
287     if (!isSnapshotCompleted(snapshot)) {
288       throw new SnapshotDoesNotExistException(snapshot);
289     }
290 
291     String snapshotName = snapshot.getName();
292     LOG.debug("Deleting snapshot: " + snapshotName);
293     // first create the snapshot description and check to see if it exists
294     MasterFileSystem fs = master.getMasterFileSystem();
295     Path snapshotDir = SnapshotDescriptionUtils.getCompletedSnapshotDir(snapshotName, rootDir);
296 
297     // delete the existing snapshot
298     if (!fs.getFileSystem().delete(snapshotDir, true)) {
299       throw new HBaseSnapshotException("Failed to delete snapshot directory: " + snapshotDir);
300     }
301 
302     // call coproc post hook
303     if (cpHost != null) {
304       cpHost.postDeleteSnapshot(snapshot);
305     }
306 
307   }
308 
309   /**
310    * Check if the specified snapshot is done
311    *
312    * @param expected
313    * @return true if snapshot is ready to be restored, false if it is still being taken.
314    * @throws IOException IOException if error from HDFS or RPC
315    * @throws UnknownSnapshotException if snapshot is invalid or does not exist.
316    */
317   public boolean isSnapshotDone(SnapshotDescription expected) throws IOException {
318     // check the request to make sure it has a snapshot
319     if (expected == null) {
320       throw new UnknownSnapshotException(
321          "No snapshot name passed in request, can't figure out which snapshot you want to check.");
322     }
323 
324     String ssString = SnapshotDescriptionUtils.toString(expected);
325 
326     // check to see if the sentinel exists,
327     // and if the task is complete removes it from the in-progress snapshots map.
328     SnapshotSentinel handler = removeSentinelIfFinished(this.snapshotHandlers, expected);
329 
330     // stop tracking "abandoned" handlers
331     cleanupSentinels();
332 
333     if (handler == null) {
334       // If there's no handler in the in-progress map, it means one of the following:
335       //   - someone has already requested the snapshot state
336       //   - the requested snapshot was completed long time ago (cleanupSentinels() timeout)
337       //   - the snapshot was never requested
338       // In those cases returns to the user the "done state" if the snapshots exists on disk,
339       // otherwise raise an exception saying that the snapshot is not running and doesn't exist.
340       if (!isSnapshotCompleted(expected)) {
341         throw new UnknownSnapshotException("Snapshot " + ssString
342             + " is not currently running or one of the known completed snapshots.");
343       }
344       // was done, return true;
345       return true;
346     }
347 
348     // pass on any failure we find in the sentinel
349     try {
350       handler.rethrowExceptionIfFailed();
351     } catch (ForeignException e) {
352       // Give some procedure info on an exception.
353       String status;
354       Procedure p = coordinator.getProcedure(expected.getName());
355       if (p != null) {
356         status = p.getStatus();
357       } else {
358         status = expected.getName() + " not found in proclist " + coordinator.getProcedureNames();
359       }
360       throw new HBaseSnapshotException("Snapshot " + ssString +  " had an error.  " + status, e,
361           expected);
362     }
363 
364     // check to see if we are done
365     if (handler.isFinished()) {
366       LOG.debug("Snapshot '" + ssString + "' has completed, notifying client.");
367       return true;
368     } else if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
369       LOG.debug("Snapshoting '" + ssString + "' is still in progress!");
370     }
371     return false;
372   }
373 
374   /**
375    * Check to see if the specified table has a snapshot in progress.  Currently we have a
376    * limitation only allowing a single snapshot per table at a time.
377    * @param tableName name of the table being snapshotted.
378    * @return <tt>true</tt> if there is a snapshot in progress on the specified table.
379    */
380   synchronized boolean isTakingSnapshot(final String tableName) {
381     SnapshotSentinel handler = this.snapshotHandlers.get(tableName);
382     return handler != null && !handler.isFinished();
383   }
384 
385   /**
386    * Check to make sure that we are OK to run the passed snapshot. Checks to make sure that we
387    * aren't already running a snapshot or restore on the requested table.
388    * @param snapshot description of the snapshot we want to start
389    * @throws HBaseSnapshotException if the filesystem could not be prepared to start the snapshot
390    */
391   private synchronized void prepareToTakeSnapshot(SnapshotDescription snapshot)
392       throws HBaseSnapshotException {
393     FileSystem fs = master.getMasterFileSystem().getFileSystem();
394     Path workingDir = SnapshotDescriptionUtils.getWorkingSnapshotDir(snapshot, rootDir);
395 
396     // make sure we aren't already running a snapshot
397     if (isTakingSnapshot(snapshot.getTable())) {
398       SnapshotSentinel handler = this.snapshotHandlers.get(snapshot.getTable());
399       throw new SnapshotCreationException("Rejected taking "
400           + SnapshotDescriptionUtils.toString(snapshot)
401           + " because we are already running another snapshot "
402           + SnapshotDescriptionUtils.toString(handler.getSnapshot()), snapshot);
403     }
404 
405     // make sure we aren't running a restore on the same table
406     if (isRestoringTable(snapshot.getTable())) {
407       SnapshotSentinel handler = restoreHandlers.get(snapshot.getTable());
408       throw new SnapshotCreationException("Rejected taking "
409           + SnapshotDescriptionUtils.toString(snapshot)
410           + " because we are already have a restore in progress on the same snapshot "
411           + SnapshotDescriptionUtils.toString(handler.getSnapshot()), snapshot);
412     }
413 
414     try {
415       // delete the working directory, since we aren't running the snapshot. Likely leftovers
416       // from a failed attempt.
417       fs.delete(workingDir, true);
418 
419       // recreate the working directory for the snapshot
420       if (!fs.mkdirs(workingDir)) {
421         throw new SnapshotCreationException("Couldn't create working directory (" + workingDir
422             + ") for snapshot" , snapshot);
423       }
424     } catch (HBaseSnapshotException e) {
425       throw e;
426     } catch (IOException e) {
427       throw new SnapshotCreationException(
428           "Exception while checking to see if snapshot could be started.", e, snapshot);
429     }
430   }
431 
432   /**
433    * Take a snapshot of a disabled table.
434    * @param snapshot description of the snapshot to take. Modified to be {@link Type#DISABLED}.
435    * @throws HBaseSnapshotException if the snapshot could not be started
436    */
437   private synchronized void snapshotDisabledTable(SnapshotDescription snapshot)
438       throws HBaseSnapshotException {
439     // setup the snapshot
440     prepareToTakeSnapshot(snapshot);
441 
442     // set the snapshot to be a disabled snapshot, since the client doesn't know about that
443     snapshot = snapshot.toBuilder().setType(Type.DISABLED).build();
444 
445     // Take the snapshot of the disabled table
446     DisabledTableSnapshotHandler handler =
447         new DisabledTableSnapshotHandler(snapshot, master, metricsMaster);
448     snapshotTable(snapshot, handler);
449   }
450 
451   /**
452    * Take a snapshot of an enabled table.
453    * @param snapshot description of the snapshot to take.
454    * @throws HBaseSnapshotException if the snapshot could not be started
455    */
456   private synchronized void snapshotEnabledTable(SnapshotDescription snapshot)
457       throws HBaseSnapshotException {
458     // setup the snapshot
459     prepareToTakeSnapshot(snapshot);
460 
461     // Take the snapshot of the enabled table
462     EnabledTableSnapshotHandler handler =
463         new EnabledTableSnapshotHandler(snapshot, master, this, metricsMaster);
464     snapshotTable(snapshot, handler);
465   }
466 
467   /**
468    * Take a snapshot using the specified handler.
469    * On failure the snapshot temporary working directory is removed.
470    * NOTE: prepareToTakeSnapshot() called before this one takes care of the rejecting the
471    *       snapshot request if the table is busy with another snapshot/restore operation.
472    * @param snapshot the snapshot description
473    * @param handler the snapshot handler
474    */
475   private synchronized void snapshotTable(SnapshotDescription snapshot,
476       final TakeSnapshotHandler handler) throws HBaseSnapshotException {
477     try {
478       handler.prepare();
479       this.executorService.submit(handler);
480       this.snapshotHandlers.put(snapshot.getTable(), handler);
481     } catch (Exception e) {
482       // cleanup the working directory by trying to delete it from the fs.
483       Path workingDir = SnapshotDescriptionUtils.getWorkingSnapshotDir(snapshot, rootDir);
484       try {
485         if (!this.master.getMasterFileSystem().getFileSystem().delete(workingDir, true)) {
486           LOG.error("Couldn't delete working directory (" + workingDir + " for snapshot:" +
487               SnapshotDescriptionUtils.toString(snapshot));
488         }
489       } catch (IOException e1) {
490         LOG.error("Couldn't delete working directory (" + workingDir + " for snapshot:" +
491             SnapshotDescriptionUtils.toString(snapshot));
492       }
493       // fail the snapshot
494       throw new SnapshotCreationException("Could not build snapshot handler", e, snapshot);
495     }
496   }
497 
498   /**
499    * Take a snapshot based on the enabled/disabled state of the table.
500    *
501    * @param snapshot
502    * @throws HBaseSnapshotException when a snapshot specific exception occurs.
503    * @throws IOException when some sort of generic IO exception occurs.
504    */
505   public void takeSnapshot(SnapshotDescription snapshot) throws IOException {
506     // check to see if we already completed the snapshot
507     if (isSnapshotCompleted(snapshot)) {
508       throw new SnapshotExistsException("Snapshot '" + snapshot.getName()
509           + "' already stored on the filesystem.", snapshot);
510     }
511 
512     LOG.debug("No existing snapshot, attempting snapshot...");
513 
514     // stop tracking "abandoned" handlers
515     cleanupSentinels();
516 
517     // check to see if the table exists
518     HTableDescriptor desc = null;
519     try {
520       desc = master.getTableDescriptors().get(snapshot.getTable());
521     } catch (FileNotFoundException e) {
522       String msg = "Table:" + snapshot.getTable() + " info doesn't exist!";
523       LOG.error(msg);
524       throw new SnapshotCreationException(msg, e, snapshot);
525     } catch (IOException e) {
526       throw new SnapshotCreationException("Error while geting table description for table "
527           + snapshot.getTable(), e, snapshot);
528     }
529     if (desc == null) {
530       throw new SnapshotCreationException("Table '" + snapshot.getTable()
531           + "' doesn't exist, can't take snapshot.", snapshot);
532     }
533 
534     // set the snapshot version, now that we are ready to take it
535     snapshot = snapshot.toBuilder().setVersion(SnapshotDescriptionUtils.SNAPSHOT_LAYOUT_VERSION)
536         .build();
537 
538     // call pre coproc hook
539     MasterCoprocessorHost cpHost = master.getCoprocessorHost();
540     if (cpHost != null) {
541       cpHost.preSnapshot(snapshot, desc);
542     }
543 
544     // if the table is enabled, then have the RS run actually the snapshot work
545     AssignmentManager assignmentMgr = master.getAssignmentManager();
546     if (assignmentMgr.getZKTable().isEnabledTable(snapshot.getTable())) {
547       LOG.debug("Table enabled, starting distributed snapshot.");
548       snapshotEnabledTable(snapshot);
549       LOG.debug("Started snapshot: " + SnapshotDescriptionUtils.toString(snapshot));
550     }
551     // For disabled table, snapshot is created by the master
552     else if (assignmentMgr.getZKTable().isDisabledTable(snapshot.getTable())) {
553       LOG.debug("Table is disabled, running snapshot entirely on master.");
554       snapshotDisabledTable(snapshot);
555       LOG.debug("Started snapshot: " + SnapshotDescriptionUtils.toString(snapshot));
556     } else {
557       LOG.error("Can't snapshot table '" + snapshot.getTable()
558           + "', isn't open or closed, we don't know what to do!");
559       TablePartiallyOpenException tpoe = new TablePartiallyOpenException(snapshot.getTable()
560           + " isn't fully open.");
561       throw new SnapshotCreationException("Table is not entirely open or closed", tpoe, snapshot);
562     }
563 
564     // call post coproc hook
565     if (cpHost != null) {
566       cpHost.postSnapshot(snapshot, desc);
567     }
568   }

570   /**
571    * Set the handler for the current snapshot
572    * <p>
573    * Exposed for TESTING
574    * @param tableName
575    * @param handler handler the master should use
576    *
577    * TODO get rid of this if possible, repackaging, modify tests.
578    */
579   public synchronized void setSnapshotHandlerForTesting(final String tableName,
580       final SnapshotSentinel handler) {
581     if (handler != null) {
582       this.snapshotHandlers.put(tableName, handler);
583     } else {
584       this.snapshotHandlers.remove(tableName);
585     }
586   }

591   ProcedureCoordinator getCoordinator() {
592     return coordinator;

595   /**
596    * Check to see if the snapshot is one of the currently completed snapshots
597    * Returns true if the snapshot exists in the "completed snapshots folder".
598    *
599    * @param snapshot expected snapshot to check
600    * @return <tt>true</tt> if the snapshot is stored on the {@link FileSystem}, <tt>false</tt> if is
601    *         not stored
602    * @throws IOException if the filesystem throws an unexpected exception,
603    * @throws IllegalArgumentException if snapshot name is invalid.
604    */
605   private boolean isSnapshotCompleted(SnapshotDescription snapshot) throws IOException {
606     try {
607       final Path snapshotDir = SnapshotDescriptionUtils.getCompletedSnapshotDir(snapshot, rootDir);
608       FileSystem fs = master.getMasterFileSystem().getFileSystem();
609 
610       // check to see if the snapshot already exists
611       return fs.exists(snapshotDir);
612     } catch (IllegalArgumentException iae) {
613       throw new UnknownSnapshotException("Unexpected exception thrown", iae);
614     }
615   }

617   /**
618    * Clone the specified snapshot into a new table.
619    * The operation will fail if the destination table has a snapshot or restore in progress.
620    *
621    * @param snapshot Snapshot Descriptor
622    * @param hTableDescriptor Table Descriptor of the table to create
623    */
624   synchronized void cloneSnapshot(final SnapshotDescription snapshot,
625       final HTableDescriptor hTableDescriptor) throws HBaseSnapshotException {
626     String tableName = hTableDescriptor.getNameAsString();
627 
628     // make sure we aren't running a snapshot on the same table
629     if (isTakingSnapshot(tableName)) {
630       throw new RestoreSnapshotException("Snapshot in progress on the restore table=" + tableName);
631     }
632 
633     // make sure we aren't running a restore on the same table
634     if (isRestoringTable(tableName)) {
635       throw new RestoreSnapshotException("Restore already in progress on the table=" + tableName);
636     }
637 
638     try {
639       CloneSnapshotHandler handler =
640         new CloneSnapshotHandler(master, snapshot, hTableDescriptor, metricsMaster);
641       this.executorService.submit(handler);
642       this.restoreHandlers.put(tableName, handler);
643     } catch (Exception e) {
644       String msg = "Couldn't clone the snapshot=" + SnapshotDescriptionUtils.toString(snapshot) +
645         " on table=" + tableName;
646       LOG.error(msg, e);
647       throw new RestoreSnapshotException(msg, e);
648     }
649   }
650 
651   /**
652    * Restore the specified snapshot
653    * @param reqSnapshot
654    * @throws IOException
655    */
656   public void restoreSnapshot(SnapshotDescription reqSnapshot) throws IOException {
657     FileSystem fs = master.getMasterFileSystem().getFileSystem();
658     Path snapshotDir = SnapshotDescriptionUtils.getCompletedSnapshotDir(reqSnapshot, rootDir);
659     MasterCoprocessorHost cpHost = master.getCoprocessorHost();
660 
661     // check if the snapshot exists
662     if (!fs.exists(snapshotDir)) {
663       LOG.error("A Snapshot named '" + reqSnapshot.getName() + "' does not exist.");
664       throw new SnapshotDoesNotExistException(reqSnapshot);
665     }
666 
667     // read snapshot information
668     SnapshotDescription fsSnapshot = SnapshotDescriptionUtils.readSnapshotInfo(fs, snapshotDir);
669     HTableDescriptor snapshotTableDesc = FSTableDescriptors.getTableDescriptor(fs, snapshotDir);
670     String tableName = reqSnapshot.getTable();
671 
672     // stop tracking "abandoned" handlers
673     cleanupSentinels();
674 
675     // Execute the restore/clone operation
676     if (MetaReader.tableExists(master.getCatalogTracker(), tableName)) {
677       if (master.getAssignmentManager().getZKTable().isEnabledTable(fsSnapshot.getTable())) {
678         throw new UnsupportedOperationException("Table '" +
679           fsSnapshot.getTable() + "' must be disabled in order to perform a restore operation.");
680       }
681 
682       // call coproc pre hook
683       if (cpHost != null) {
684         cpHost.preRestoreSnapshot(reqSnapshot, snapshotTableDesc);
685       }
686       restoreSnapshot(fsSnapshot, snapshotTableDesc);
687       LOG.info("Restore snapshot=" + fsSnapshot.getName() + " as table=" + tableName);
688 
689       if (cpHost != null) {
690         cpHost.postRestoreSnapshot(reqSnapshot, snapshotTableDesc);
691       }
692     } else {
693       HTableDescriptor htd = RestoreSnapshotHelper.cloneTableSchema(snapshotTableDesc,
694                                                          Bytes.toBytes(tableName));
695       if (cpHost != null) {
696         cpHost.preCloneSnapshot(reqSnapshot, htd);
697       }
698       cloneSnapshot(fsSnapshot, htd);
699       LOG.info("Clone snapshot=" + fsSnapshot.getName() + " as table=" + tableName);
700 
701       if (cpHost != null) {
702         cpHost.postCloneSnapshot(reqSnapshot, htd);
703       }
704     }
705   }
706 
707   /**
708    * Restore the specified snapshot.
709    * The restore will fail if the destination table has a snapshot or restore in progress.
710    *
711    * @param snapshot Snapshot Descriptor
712    * @param hTableDescriptor Table Descriptor
713    */
714   private synchronized void restoreSnapshot(final SnapshotDescription snapshot,
715       final HTableDescriptor hTableDescriptor) throws HBaseSnapshotException {
716     String tableName = hTableDescriptor.getNameAsString();
717 
718     // make sure we aren't running a snapshot on the same table
719     if (isTakingSnapshot(tableName)) {
720       throw new RestoreSnapshotException("Snapshot in progress on the restore table=" + tableName);
721     }
722 
723     // make sure we aren't running a restore on the same table
724     if (isRestoringTable(tableName)) {
725       throw new RestoreSnapshotException("Restore already in progress on the table=" + tableName);
726     }
727 
728     try {
729       RestoreSnapshotHandler handler =
730         new RestoreSnapshotHandler(master, snapshot, hTableDescriptor, metricsMaster);
731       this.executorService.submit(handler);
732       restoreHandlers.put(hTableDescriptor.getNameAsString(), handler);
733     } catch (Exception e) {
734       String msg = "Couldn't restore the snapshot=" + SnapshotDescriptionUtils.toString(
735           snapshot)  +
736           " on table=" + tableName;
737       LOG.error(msg, e);
738       throw new RestoreSnapshotException(msg, e);
739     }
740   }
741 
742   /**
743    * Verify if the restore of the specified table is in progress.
744    *
745    * @param tableName table under restore
746    * @return <tt>true</tt> if there is a restore in progress of the specified table.
747    */
748   private synchronized boolean isRestoringTable(final String tableName) {
749     SnapshotSentinel sentinel = this.restoreHandlers.get(tableName);
750     return(sentinel != null && !sentinel.isFinished());
751   }
752 
753   /**
754    * Returns the status of a restore operation.
755    * If the in-progress restore is failed throws the exception that caused the failure.
756    *
757    * @param snapshot
758    * @return false if in progress, true if restore is completed or not requested.
759    * @throws IOException if there was a failure during the restore
760    */
761   public boolean isRestoreDone(final SnapshotDescription snapshot) throws IOException {
762     // check to see if the sentinel exists,
763     // and if the task is complete removes it from the in-progress restore map.
764     SnapshotSentinel sentinel = removeSentinelIfFinished(this.restoreHandlers, snapshot);
765 
766     // stop tracking "abandoned" handlers
767     cleanupSentinels();
768 
769     if (sentinel == null) {
770       // there is no sentinel so restore is not in progress.
771       return true;
772     }
773 
774     LOG.debug("Verify snapshot=" + snapshot.getName() + " against="
775         + sentinel.getSnapshot().getName() + " table=" + snapshot.getTable());
776 
777     // If the restore is failed, rethrow the exception
778     sentinel.rethrowExceptionIfFailed();
779 
780     // check to see if we are done
781     if (sentinel.isFinished()) {
782       LOG.debug("Restore snapshot=" + SnapshotDescriptionUtils.toString(snapshot) +
783           " has completed. Notifying the client.");
784       return true;
785     }
786 
787     if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
788       LOG.debug("Sentinel is not yet finished with restoring snapshot=" +
789           SnapshotDescriptionUtils.toString(snapshot));
790     }
791     return false;
792   }
793 
794   /**
795    * Return the handler if it is currently live and has the same snapshot target name.
796    * The handler is removed from the sentinels map if completed.
797    * @param sentinels live handlers
798    * @param snapshot snapshot description
799    * @return null if doesn't match, else a live handler.
800    */
801   private synchronized SnapshotSentinel removeSentinelIfFinished(
802       final Map<String, SnapshotSentinel> sentinels, final SnapshotDescription snapshot) {
803     SnapshotSentinel h = sentinels.get(snapshot.getTable());
804     if (h == null) {
805       return null;
806     }
807 
808     if (!h.getSnapshot().getName().equals(snapshot.getName())) {
809       // specified snapshot is to the one currently running
810       return null;
811     }
812 
813     // Remove from the "in-progress" list once completed
814     if (h.isFinished()) {
815       sentinels.remove(snapshot.getTable());
816     }
817 
818     return h;
819   }
820 
821   /**
822    * Removes "abandoned" snapshot/restore requests.
823    * As part of the HBaseAdmin snapshot/restore API the operation status is checked until completed,
824    * and the in-progress maps are cleaned up when the status of a completed task is requested.
825    * To avoid having sentinels staying around for long time if something client side is failed,
826    * each operation tries to clean up the in-progress maps sentinels finished from a long time.
827    */
828   private void cleanupSentinels() {
829     cleanupSentinels(this.snapshotHandlers);
830     cleanupSentinels(this.restoreHandlers);
831   }
832 
833   /**
834    * Remove the sentinels that are marked as finished and the completion time
835    * has exceeded the removal timeout.
836    * @param sentinels map of sentinels to clean
837    */
838   private synchronized void cleanupSentinels(final Map<String, SnapshotSentinel> sentinels) {
839     long currentTime = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis();
840     Iterator<Map.Entry<String, SnapshotSentinel>> it = sentinels.entrySet().iterator();
841     while (it.hasNext()) {
842       Map.Entry<String, SnapshotSentinel> entry = it.next();
843       SnapshotSentinel sentinel = entry.getValue();
844       if (sentinel.isFinished() &&
845           (currentTime - sentinel.getCompletionTimestamp()) > SNAPSHOT_SENTINELS_CLEANUP_TIMEOUT)
846       {
847         it.remove();
848       }
849     }
850   }

852   //
853   // Implementing Stoppable interface
854   //
855 
856   @Override
857   public void stop(String why) {
858     // short circuit
859     if (this.stopped) return;
860     // make sure we get stop
861     this.stopped = true;
862     // pass the stop onto take snapshot handlers
863     for (SnapshotSentinel snapshotHandler: this.snapshotHandlers.values()) {
864       snapshotHandler.cancel(why);
865     }
866 
867     // pass the stop onto all the restore handlers
868     for (SnapshotSentinel restoreHandler: this.restoreHandlers.values()) {
869       restoreHandler.cancel(why);
870     }
871     try {
872       coordinator.close();
873     } catch (IOException e) {
874       LOG.error("stop ProcedureCoordinator error", e);
875     }
876   }
877 
878   @Override
879   public boolean isStopped() {
880     return this.stopped;
881   }

883   /**
884    * Throws an exception if snapshot operations (take a snapshot, restore, clone) are not supported.
885    * Called at the beginning of snapshot() and restoreSnapshot() methods.
886    * @throws UnsupportedOperationException if snapshot are not supported
887    */
888   public void checkSnapshotSupport() throws UnsupportedOperationException {
889     if (!this.isSnapshotSupported) {
890       throw new UnsupportedOperationException(
891         "To use snapshots, You must add to the hbase-site.xml of the HBase Master: '" +
892           HBASE_SNAPSHOT_ENABLED + "' property with value 'true'.");
893     }
894   }
895 
896   /**
897    * Called at startup, to verify if snapshot operation is supported, and to avoid
898    * starting the master if there're snapshots present but the cleaners needed are missing.
899    * Otherwise we can end up with snapshot data loss.
900    * @param conf The {@link Configuration} object to use
901    * @param mfs The MasterFileSystem to use
902    * @throws IOException in case of file-system operation failure
903    * @throws UnsupportedOperationException in case cleaners are missing and
904    *         there're snapshot in the system
905    */
906   private void checkSnapshotSupport(final Configuration conf, final MasterFileSystem mfs)
907       throws IOException, UnsupportedOperationException {
908     // Verify if snapshot is disabled by the user
909     String enabled = conf.get(HBASE_SNAPSHOT_ENABLED);
910     boolean snapshotEnabled = conf.getBoolean(HBASE_SNAPSHOT_ENABLED, false);
911     boolean userDisabled = (enabled != null && enabled.trim().length() > 0 && !snapshotEnabled);
912 
913     // Extract cleaners from conf
914     Set<String> hfileCleaners = new HashSet<String>();
915     String[] cleaners = conf.getStrings(HFileCleaner.MASTER_HFILE_CLEANER_PLUGINS);
916     if (cleaners != null) Collections.addAll(hfileCleaners, cleaners);
917 
918     Set<String> logCleaners = new HashSet<String>();
919     cleaners = conf.getStrings(HConstants.HBASE_MASTER_LOGCLEANER_PLUGINS);
920     if (cleaners != null) Collections.addAll(logCleaners, cleaners);
921 
922     // If the user has enabled the snapshot, we force the cleaners to be present
923     // otherwise we still need to check if cleaners are enabled or not and verify
924     // that there're no snapshot in the .snapshot folder.
925     if (snapshotEnabled) {
926       // Inject snapshot cleaners, if snapshot.enable is true
927       hfileCleaners.add(SnapshotHFileCleaner.class.getName());
928       hfileCleaners.add(HFileLinkCleaner.class.getName());
929       logCleaners.add(SnapshotLogCleaner.class.getName());
930 
931       // Set cleaners conf
932       conf.setStrings(HFileCleaner.MASTER_HFILE_CLEANER_PLUGINS,
933         hfileCleaners.toArray(new String[hfileCleaners.size()]));
934       conf.setStrings(HConstants.HBASE_MASTER_LOGCLEANER_PLUGINS,
935         logCleaners.toArray(new String[logCleaners.size()]));
936     } else {
937       // Verify if cleaners are present
938       snapshotEnabled = logCleaners.contains(SnapshotLogCleaner.class.getName()) &&
939         hfileCleaners.contains(SnapshotHFileCleaner.class.getName()) &&
940         hfileCleaners.contains(HFileLinkCleaner.class.getName());
941 
942       // Warn if the cleaners are enabled but the snapshot.enabled property is false/not set.
943       if (snapshotEnabled) {
944         LOG.warn("Snapshot log and hfile cleaners are present in the configuration, " +
945           "but the '" + HBASE_SNAPSHOT_ENABLED + "' property " +
946           (userDisabled ? "is set to 'false'." : "is not set."));
947       }
948     }
949 
950     // Mark snapshot feature as enabled if cleaners are present and user has not disabled it.
951     this.isSnapshotSupported = snapshotEnabled && !userDisabled;
952 
953     // If cleaners are not enabled, verify that there're no snapshot in the .snapshot folder
954     // otherwise we end up with snapshot data loss.
955     if (!snapshotEnabled) {
956       LOG.info("Snapshot feature is not enabled, missing log and hfile cleaners.");
957       Path snapshotDir = SnapshotDescriptionUtils.getSnapshotsDir(mfs.getRootDir());
958       FileSystem fs = mfs.getFileSystem();
959       if (fs.exists(snapshotDir)) {
960         FileStatus[] snapshots = FSUtils.listStatus(fs, snapshotDir,
961           new SnapshotDescriptionUtils.CompletedSnaphotDirectoriesFilter(fs));
962         if (snapshots != null) {
963           LOG.error("Snapshots are present, but cleaners are not enabled.");
964           checkSnapshotSupport();
965         }
966       }
967     }
968   }
